definition: to extinguish or put out/to go out (of a fire etc)/to exterminate or wipe out/to drown

sentences.english: The counter-revolutionary gang was on the rampage for a time, but before long it was completely overthrown.
sentences.chinese: 猖獗一时的反革命匪帮，曾几何时，遭到了彻底覆灭。

sentences.english: It will eventually succumb to the forces of freedom and progress.
sentences.chinese: 它最终将覆灭于自由与进步的力量。

sentences.english: So stop feeding it and let it wither on the vine.
sentences.chinese: 所以请停止喂养它，尽快让它覆灭吧。

sentences.english: The complete collapse of the Kuomintang troops in the Northeast then became a foregone conclusion .
sentences.chinese: 此时，东北国民党军全军覆灭的命运，已成定局。

sentences.english: Recurrent slave uprisings brought about the downfall of the ancient roman empire .
sentences.chinese: 不断出现的奴隶起义导致了古罗马帝国的覆灭。

sentences.english: Contagion will spread across the euro zone. The end will come soon enough.
sentences.chinese: 恐慌会蔓延到整个欧元区，欧元的覆灭也将随之而来。

definition: to be destroyed/to become extinct/to perish/to die out/to destroy/to exterminate
extermination of an entire family (ancient Chinese punishment)
total defeat of an army (idiom); fig. a complete wipeout
remaining evil element/surviving members (of evil former regime)/dregs (of colonial administration)
(of a nation) to be destroyed/subjugation/vanquished nation
